review: Setup is a breeze. There is a little lag sometimes that is noticable but it's almost negligible. We gave up on cable and have been using this instead. A serious money saver at only $35.
author: Chris Gaines

review: I bought 2 of these when first released, lasted about a month then overheated and burned out.Have gone through 5 weeks of trying to get googles outsourced support to rma to replace them.  They keep roadblocking me to avoid replacing them.The only devices I could reliably use with these were my apple stuff, in windows I like IE and couldn't get it to work.
author: emil engler

review: First try - everything performed perfectly.  Just can't play games that require fast action choices.  There is about a four-second lag vetween what you see on your device and what appears on the TV screen.
author: G. Harmon

review: This product is excellent without purchasing a smart tv. Setting up is easy, but I keep getting connected to wifi but can't access internet. Takes a while to troubleshoote problem, once you get over that problem there smooth sailing.
author: Garth

review: Nice product if you love watching Youtube.  Netflix is a bonus. No remote - your computer, tablet, smart phone is the remote, so if you have a slow device, and a slow internet connection, it can drag a bit except for YouTube videos which stream directly via.For $35 it's a winner. It's not Apple TV, but I'm in the Google Play playground with music, movies, tunes, etc so I don't have to deal with the massive RAM hog that is iTunes to make Apple TV work.Bottom line, if you're an Android user or a Youtube fan looking for a cheap way to see your pics, vids, music on TV this is a winner.
author: Bill T

review: I got the TV side of it hooked up.I have been trying to do it through my Windows 7 computer without success.I have spent no less than 4-5 hours trying to get it to work,and I have not succeeded.I feel like I am near getting it done, but not yet!!!Thus, what is there to like!!!
author: RAY

review: fast shipper, great device, good price! this works like a charm on just about any tv (with an HDMI port on it) i've tried it on... love the ability to "cast" video on the big screen and control it via my phone!
author: Shaun Chaudoin

review: For $35, you have to go in to this thing expecting the minimum, but Google did a great job with this product.  I'm having a bit of an issue with occasionally resetting the device due to it having an issue switching from taking instruction from a laptop to taking instruction from a smartphone, but otherwise, it works well.
